titleInfo.title: "Memphis-bred band strolls in jazz world's high cotton"

mods.abstract: "If you live in the cradle of the blues, you might easily have missed out on the rebirth of one of Memphis' favorite sons. -- That's because it is happening on the West Coast, where Dixieland and blues-tinged jazz from the W.C. Handy era have become yet another California phenomenon. -- And Memphis's own Hot Cotton Jazz Band is in the thick of it. -- More than 100,000 paying customers came last spring to listen to Hot Cotton and other so-called 'traditional jazz bands' at the annual Sacramento Dixieland Jubilee. It's the oldest of dozens of festivals that have sprung up in California and, recently, found their way as close to Memphis as Chattanooga..."

relatedItem.abstract: A collection of all things Memphis... a little bit of this, a little bit of that. The M Files is a great place to find portraits and newspaper clippings, but also so much more. As the clippings from the Memphis Information File are digitized, they will be added to The M Files, but so will the smaller manuscript collections and most of the items used to create the topical digital displays in the Memphis Room.
